pipeline.description: Pipeline implements the last step of the cart checkout process, which is submitting the order.

text-node.description: This pipeline is responsible to create an order from the current basket. It's a pure processing pipeline and does no page rendering. The pipeline is used by the checkout and is called upon the triggered place order action. It contains the actual logic to authorize the payment and create the order. The pipeline communicates the result of the order creation process by named end nodes and uses a status object PlaceOrderError to set proper error states. The calling pipeline is responsible to react on these end nodes and to evaluate the error status.
The entry point for the order creation. The start node needs to be private since it is supposed to be called by pipelines only.

pipelet-node.custom-name: Construct error status, use either preset status from payment authorization which may contain provider specific error message, or create generic error status

key-binding.alias: 'isChildAccount' in CurrentCustomer.profile.custom && CurrentCustomer.profile.custom.isChildAccount && 'manageusercheckBox' in CurrentCustomer.profile.custom && CurrentCustomer.profile.custom.manageusercheckBox && 'adminEmail' in CurrentCustomer.profile.custom && !empty(CurrentCustomer.profile.custom.adminEmail)?CurrentCustomer.profile.custom.adminEmail:''

text-node.description: Responsible for payment handling. This pipeline calls the specific authorization pipelines for each individual payment type. It ends on an named "error" end node if either any of the authorizations failed or a payment instrument is of an unknown payment method. If a payment method has no payment processor assigned, the payment is deemed as authorized.

pipelet-node.custom-name: Just set transaction ID if processor is unknown

text-node.description: Responsible for creating the order, set the order status to 'Created'
Clears all forms used in the checkout process.
Responsible for placing the order and set the order status to 'New'
Clean shipments.
Make sure there are valid shipping address, accounting for gift certificate that would not have one.
Make sure, the billing step has been fulfilled, otherwise restart checkout.

An Authorization Pipeline is being dynamically called based on a concatenation of the current Payment-Processor and a constant suffix (-Authorize).
For example: Credit Cards processor ID = BASIC_CREDIT Authorization Pipeline = BASIC_CREDIT-Authorize
The authorization pipeline must end in a named "error" end node to communicate any authorization error back to this pipeline.
Additionally the authorization pipeline may put a dw.system.Status object into the pipeline dictonary under key PlaceOrderError, which contains provider specific error messages.
Validate the cart against availability and price calculation.
This pipeline is responsible to process information supplied by the user during the checkout and saves a used credit card to the customer payment instruments.
These pipelines contain past order creation logic. However, they must be called within the transaction.
Recalculate the payments. If there is only gift certificates, make sure it covers the order total, if not back to billing page.
Handle used addresses and credit cards.
Removing the COPlaceOrder-ProcessPersonalInformation.
Creates a gift certificate for each gift certificate line item in the order and sends an email to the gift certificate receiver.
Create a new order, with PlaceOrder=false. This will internally ReserveInventoryForOrder and will create a new Order with status 'Created'.

Handle the payment authorization, use the created order number as reference for external payment transactions. Note that this is also the departure point for asynchronous payments. The 'Submit' pipeline action allows for asynchronous callback to perform the actual PlaceOrder function.
Asynchronous Callbacks for OCAPI. These functions result in a JSON response.
Asynchronous Callback Pipeline Actions (private actions). Public API for these will wrap with a format appropriate output (HTML or JSON output)
Sets the Order status to 'New'.
Copy the customer's accountNumber, cardNumber and/or chainCode. Place empty strings if no value.
Asynchronous Callbacks for SiteGenesis
Creates purchased gift certificates with this order.
All errors must explicitly call FailOrder, to revive the Basket … or the customer order will remain unaccessible
Send order confirmation and clear used forms within the checkout process.
Mark order as EXPORT_STATUS_READY.
Adds the % for discount models onto the order as custom attributes - required by CosmoProf OMS to allow for proper attribution to DSCs
Order successfully created, communicate status back to calling pipeline.
